EXISTING STRUCTURES
### Stone Furnace Smelting Setup at position (41.0, -82.0)
Consists of a stone furnace central to the smelting process. It receives ingredients (iron ore and coal) and produces iron plates. Two logistic subsystems have been developed around it:
• Initial logistic subsystem:
 – Wooden Chest at position (42.5, -81.5) placed next to the furnace to receive extracted iron plates.
 – Burner Inserter originally placed at position (43.5, -81.5) and rotated to feed items into the chest (later removed due to misplacement).
• Updated logistic subsystem:
 – Burner Inserter at position (41.5, -83.5), installed and rotated to face UP to pickup items directly from the furnace.
 – Wooden Chest at position (41.5, -84.5) placed to receive items transferred by the new burner inserter.

ERROR TIPS
• Placement conflicts – When attempting to place an entity (e.g., burner inserter) adjacent to an existing object (e.g., wooden chest), verify that the target tile is unoccupied by other entities. Adjust spacing or change direction/reference position to avoid collisions.
• Extended production delays – If the furnace does not produce the expected amount of iron plates after multiple iterations, confirm that the necessary ingredients (iron ore and coal) are present before initiating smelting to prevent timeout exceptions.
• Insertion resource mismatches – Before executing an insert_item operation, ensure that the inventory contains the required resource (coal or iron ore) to avoid insertion errors.
